full_summary:
---

**RFSO: Arborist Services**
=====================================

**Reference Number**
-----------------

WS3372931686-Doc3676251319

**Amendment Number**
------------------

1

**Release Date**
----------------

2023-03-27

**Closing Date**
----------------

2023-04-25T14:00:00

**Tender Details**
-----------------

A Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) is issued by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Department of National Defence (DND).

**Background**
------------

DND requires the provision of tree trimming and removal services on an “as-and-when-requested” basis at various sites in/around Greater Victoria and in/around Nanaimo and Nanoose Bay.

**Terms**
-----------

The successful supplier will be awarded a Standing Offer for a period of 2 years. The offeror has the option to extend the offer by 1 additional year under the same conditions.

**Security Requirements**
-------------------------

This document contains security requirements which must be met by the successful supplier.

**Specifications**
-----------------

Further specifications and details are contained in the solicitation package. Suppliers are required to review the solicitation package thoroughly to determine their eligibility and prepare a response.

**Trade Agreements**
-----------------

The Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), as well as other trade agreements, may apply to this procurement.

** Geographical Area**
---------------------

Services will be performed primarily in the province of British Columbia.

**Procurement Category**
-------------------------

This RFSO falls under the Services (SRV) category.

**Contact Information**
------------------------

For further information or to obtain the solicitation package, please contact:

Bill Reusch (SPAC/PSPC) at:

bill.reusch@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Ensure readability, proper markdown formatting, and keep the text as concise as possible.
